meeting_annotations.speaker: Holly Goodson
meeting_annotations.transcript: we know we're going to need to assign a recorder. So what I was going to suggest is if you could find out who's birthday is closest to today.
meeting_annotations.other: The speaker uses a creative, light-hearted method to assign a team role.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Jan Spille
meeting_annotations.transcript: Well mine is in nine days.
meeting_annotations.other: The speaker laughs while responding, indicating a positive reception to the icebreaker.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Holly Goodson
meeting_annotations.transcript: In nine days, okay. Is there anybody who's closer than that? Silence out there. It sounds like a so do you pronounce your name John or Jan?

meeting_annotations.speaker: Jan Spille
meeting_annotations.transcript: Jan, yes. Do you have a list to verify that just really quick?
meeting_annotations.other: The speaker makes a joke, continuing the light-hearted tone of the role assignment.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Holly Goodson
meeting_annotations.transcript: I do not. So it may be that you're going to just have to fall on this particular sword. But have you already have you already been a reporter?
meeting_annotations.other: The speaker uses a playful metaphor ("fall on this particular sword").

meeting_annotations.speaker: Jan Spille
meeting_annotations.transcript: I have not. So I'll be I'll be doing it.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Holly Goodson
meeting_annotations.transcript: So I think I think you are our reporter. And then the other thing I think we'll need to do is do again the same brief introduction around the room. I think a lot of people are starting to get to know each other but still there's some people that that don't. And so I'll just start by briefly saying I'm Holly Goodson from the University of Notre Dame and I work on self-organization of biological systems especially in the cytoskeleton. Okay? So I'll then I'll maybe call on people by the order that they appear on my screen. So Yan Yu, could you please introduce yourself?
meeting_annotations.other: The speaker clearly outlines the next steps for the meeting and models the expected format for introductions.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Jan Spille
meeting_annotations.transcript: Sure. My name is Jan Spille. I'm at the University of Illinois in Chicago and I'm in the physics department. We are interested in how the cell nucleus is organized, in particular how the interplay of chromatin scaffolding and then protein condensation on top of that allows you to regulate transcription. And I'm an experimentalist so we do a lot of single molecule super resolution imaging, but I'm also very interested in talking with people who do modeling for example or synthetic stuff so we can get a better systematic understanding of what's going on.
meeting_annotations.other: He explicitly states his interest in collaborating with people with different expertise (modeling, synthetic biology).

meeting_annotations.speaker: Yan Yu
meeting_annotations.transcript: Thank you Holly. So hi I'm Yan Yu. Seems like my name pronounces the same way as the other Jan. And my lab also does super resolution in fluorescence imaging of cell membranes. So we're very interested in understanding immune cell functions particularly what happens at the membrane interface between pathogens and host immune cells. We want to know how receptors self-organized and organized and have synergistic signaling for immune functions.
meeting_annotations.other: She connects her name to the previous speaker's, creating a small social link.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Seth Childers
meeting_annotations.transcript: Yes my name is Seth Childers. I'm from the University of Pittsburgh and I'm interested in the role of phase separation in organizing biochemical processes in bacteria. We've looked at mRNA decay and signal transduction. Also interested in synthetic membraneless organelles in bacteria.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Holly Goodson
meeting_annotations.transcript: Great. We may be coming back to you for your expertise in this particular area but uh Grace Stokes.
meeting_annotations.other: She foreshadows a potential future discussion topic based on the speaker's expertise.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Grace Stokes
meeting_annotations.transcript: Hi I'm Grace Stokes. I'm at Santa Clara University which is in Northern California and we are a primarily undergraduate institution. I use non-linear optical laser-based spectroscopy, second harmonic generation to study drug absorption to lipid bilayers of varying phases and varying compositions and so that's my interest in this field.
meeting_annotations.other: She specifies the type of institution she is from (primarily undergraduate), which provides context for her research environment.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Gulcin Pekkurnaz
meeting_annotations.transcript: Good morning everyone. My name is Gulcin Pekkurnaz. I'm at UCSD. I'm an assistant professor at the neurobiology section, actually the biology division. My lab studies neuronal metabolism and mitochondria.
